comment: Dr. Ray creates a really great stress-free environment to learn. Very understandable and really wants you to pass and succeed so long as you do the work. Often ties in real life experiences with his lectures. One of the best professors I've had.

Professor is a truly great teacher. In all regards you get what you give. Nonetheless, he has great stories, cares a lot about the students and their success, and shows you neat tricks in R (programming language) to solve problems. I highly recommend this professor for STAT2332.

He is nice & will answer questions but sometimes I never got the response I was looking for. Very unorganized, goes fast . If you are good with stat and coding you will be fine. Not many grades (2 Test, 3 HW, 1 Project) the project directions are very unclear and he doesn't explain good. Helps alot with HW but not really test/project

Dr. Ray is the #1 kindest professor Ive ever had. He cares about his students as people and genuinely wants to see them succeed. He has the easiest grading policy ever (over half credit just for turning in homeworks on time). Answers all questions kindly and thoughtfully and really encourages students. Great guy

Dr Ray is very friendly and cares about the students. He will answer emails and do his best to help in any way he can. He is a bit unorganized and can get sidetracked. He was very happy to answer questions, and if he didn't know the answer, he would try to work it out right in class. If he couldn't get it, he would get back with you.
All lectures are on d2l. A couple of homework grades from the book. If you have any question ASK he is always willing to help even during class time. open note test. Great professor!

Just attend the lectures and make sure you know how to use excel! His quizzes are online and the homework is usually very similar to his lectures! As long as you go to class and take good notes, you should be fine. GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS IF YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS!!!

Really liked Dr. Ray he was very knowledgable and talks really fast. Always makes sure he is being fair. Once he took a while to grade our homework that he just gave us a 100 instead. I think that he has a hectic teaching style, but after a few classes you get used to it.

Hard to fail. BUT, although he's very friendly, he's extremely disorganized. Includes a lot of extra jargon. Not only is his way of teaching the course confusing, but he expects people to know what he's talking about. YOU WILL STRUGGLE IF YOU DON'T KNOW STATS. That being said, it's hard to not pass the class.  -2 exams;1 project (project is easy).

Dr. Ray is a very passionate professor. He's funny, smart and wants everyone to succeed. If you want to learn stat for yourself, don't take him. If you'd like to be careful guided through stat take him. You have to put in some work, but its definitely possibly to get an A. He's always willing to help and looks for ways to make the learning easier

Dr. Ray is a very kind professor and tries extremely hard to make the concepts clear, but I honestly didn't learn anything from that class. Since most of the students were just as confused as I was, he basically walked us through the everything. It is very possible to do well in the class, but you may not learn much in it.

Dr. Ray is passionate, knowledgeable, and he cares about his students. We covered a lot of material and the math and theory was mind-blowing. I gained from the group interactions. Be prepared to put a lot of time in, and do a lot of self-teaching, and living in his office. It's the only way to survive any of Dr. Ray's classes.

Dr. Ray was absolutely amazing! He was very helpful. I had to email him like crazy to understand the concepts and he really helped me to understand them. Statistics is a toughie, and It wasnt clicking but if you ask him a lot of questions and put forth at least some effort you will make a good grade. I barely understood the concepts and made a B.

Dr. Ray is an extremely patient, extremely friendly professor. He is very passionate about statistics and he is thorough in all of his lectures. You won't have any problem passing the class as long as you attend class and keep up with the concepts and assignments. Don't be afraid to ask questions, either. I wish he taught all of my classes!

Dr. Ray knows the subject. He is REALLY laid back, extremely nice and approachable. His trouble is with teaching novices. His tests are extremely difficult, but he tries to compensate with other assignments. It could be that the course covers too much material in one semester... but I would be reluctant (if you have a choice).

Super easy going and really knows how to teach. Go to class, if you don't I doubt you'll make a good grade not to mention he gives participation as a grade. Found the tests a bit difficult, but he is MORE than willing to help you and really helps you understand. Take him!
